tweets.content:
#Bitcoin/ Stock market ‚Äì What‚Äôs Next?

The Big Sunday Report: All You Need to Know

üö© TA / LCA / Psychological Breakdown:

There is no longer a reason to stay MAX bearish as we have been recently after the most recent liquidation event, this does not mean to become MAX bullish. Trading is more than black and white and now is the moment to analyse the next big move. The record breaking liquidation cascade is exactly what I wanted to see, and it finally happened. Congratulations if you survived the largest liquidation crash in crypto‚Äôs history. Confirmation to everyone who shorted the market with me, including the many altcoins that went straight to zero and the buy orders that got filled for us at extreme lows. The short profits on altcoins were insane, far more than most ever made trading them. Everyone who trusted my calls and warnings is now sitting as a winner.
Over 1.6 million traders liquidated, an unprecedented figure that shows how crowded the long side was, again exaclty as I mentioned in the last weeks, something we never saw before. Practically everyone who was long got wiped as prices collapsed to zero in countless pairs. Since August, market makers have been selling BTC and altcoins heavily, quietly building short positions while retail kept buying and longing every small bounce. I called this range a distribution phase for a reason it was clear that a massive liquidation event had to come, and it did. Ladies and gentleman, this trade was Perfectly executed. Several altcoin buy orders that have been shared in DrProfit Premium Telegram (Join: whop.com/drprofit-trading/dr‚Ä¶) two weeks ago were triggered:

SUI at $0.90
XRP at $1.60
ONDO at $0.40
ETH at $3,200
HYPE at $20

This is one of the most insane trades I ever took, shorts printed hard especially on altcoins, and the buy orders that triggered caused an event of max profits, something that cant be described in normal words.

This strategic wipeout can have two possible meanings:

Market makers have decided to end the bull market and realize their final profits on altcoins, longs, and spot holdings after weeks of distribution. Or this was the cleansing event before the next leg, a total reset before renewed accumulation, especially to send altcoins higher. So what will it be and what is the correct way of positioning? The answer is more complex as this requires a strong risk management, especially in our situation the gains are massive, we have the over-hand to decide and take risks, others can only dream about. This means, our altcoin entries are something that needs another 20-25% BTC drop to see our altcoins visiting our entry price, for this I consider my current altcoin bags extremley safe. 

The Blood Moon event prediction played out too, historically, 21‚Äì28 days after a blood moon, a sharp market crash follows. This time it came after 33 days. The rule repeated. Today‚Äôs move didn‚Äôt just destroy retail bulls, it also hurt structured trading desks and even some market-making firms, that shows something major broke beneath the surface. We‚Äôll see the full picture in the coming days or weeks. This is why I mentioned that the situation is more complex than up or down right now, we dont have the extreme anymore. The extreme was days ago, bulls have been extreme, they have been greedy and desperate. They got humbled, now the market is clean. Interestingly, the event came just days after FTX repayments, something I warned about repeatedly. Events following those repayments tend to be extremely bearish, either driven by fear, manipulation, or strategic liquidation of new inflows. And that‚Äôs exactly what this was: a total annihilation of leveraged longs, as almost EVERYONE in a long position, even with a leverage of 2-3x was liquidated. This is why you have seen DrProfit holding zero altcoins or ZERO altcoin longs before this crash happened.  The real target was clear, to liquidate as many players as possible, especially the overleveraged altcoin crowd. Altcoins saw liquidation rates close to 99%. They are fully cleaned. That‚Äôs why I consider our current altcoin entries extremely safe, even if BTC sees another drop. Our positions remain:

SUI at $0.90
XRP at $1.60
ONDO at $0.40
ETH at $3,200
HYPE at $20

These remain long-term positions to hold.

Don‚Äôt fall for the media‚Äôs narrative that tariffs caused this crash. The truth is simpler: greed and leverage destroyed this market. The same reckless euphoria that always ends the cycle. Even the stock market reflects similar pressure. On Monday, U.S. markets open as usual, but because of Columbus Day, all Federal systems except FedNow will be closed. That means financial institutions won‚Äôt be able to transfer funds between each other, a dangerous setup if stocks drop and margin calls start.

On the macro front, China has just banned purchases of NVIDIA GPUs, which is massive considering China accounts for ~40% of NVIDIA‚Äôs revenue. Many of those sales booked through Singapore and Taiwan were to Chinese clients all along. Now, both China and U.S. firms are cutting GPU demand, with American companies accelerating efforts to replace NVIDIA chips with in-house alternatives. As predicted, NVIDIA‚Äôs demand cliff is forming, and the company is scrambling to cover it up with inflated figures before the decline becomes obvious.

Market Context: 

The historic altcoin liquidation event we witnessed has effectively delivered what the 90k BTC target was meant to trigger. This means the original downside projection must now be recalculated, as the market achieved the same cleansing effect without BTC needing to hit 90k. Outlook: For now, the strategy remains simple, hold cash + the BTC and altcoin spot positions and the BTC short hedge until Monday‚Äôs stock market open gives us new directional clarity, maybe the clarity needs more time, but from there, we will determine whether the next major leg favors renewed bullish accumulation or continuation of defensive positioning. In the meantime, if for example the price goes up, our altcoins and BTC spot position will print big while the short positions for altcoins and BTC will decrease in value, but will not touch the red. Based on the fact that the short positions have been closed half of position size during the crash, we already realized half of the profits, and these profits ended up into the BTC spot position allowing the highest form of risk management and capital protection.

We now wait for the stock market open on Monday for confirmation whether the next leg will be bullish or if this was the final top, but as for now I lean towards a BULLISH move with a new ATH at $130,000! Means, the white line has to hold at all cost, its the invalidation of the bullish thesis. No matter what I lean bullish as of now, but this doesnt change my risk management strategy. We have all the time to adjust, based on the stock market opening. Again, I see a great opportunity with every crash, when there is blood in the streets its to be bought. This is what we did at 105-110k when we bought BTC during the dip and added the altcoins. Now its time to watch the market how it behaves. This is a very short term decision and the final decision will be made in a couple of days wether to keep the bullish theory or to remain with the original plan to stay bearish. Based on our decision we will act on our trades and pull the final triggers, now the strategy is to have the triggers ready, but to pull we need to watch the stock market reaction. There is no need for full risk exposure as both, bull and bear sides have now the same probabilities after the recent crash. I hope you understand.

Now let the dust settle, we prepare for the next major move. It‚Äôs still early to call the next direction with certainty, but one thing is already clear: the max-bearish scenario is off the table. The market has reset. Bulls and bears now stand on equal ground in crypto, the imbalance is gone. However, equities haven‚Äôt caught up yet. #Bitcoin/ Stock market ‚Äì What‚Äôs Next?

The Big Sunday Report: All You Need to Know

üö© TA / LCA / Psychological Breakdown:

This is the last post I am going to publish this month. I will be back in November, in the meantime I will drink tea, tea and even more tea. The market is entering a highly unstable zone. Yet people cant see or understand due to the euphoria in the market, and yet my Sell Zone of 115-125k region remains a large distribution area in which large players are selling into the crowd that is buying happily not understanding that the sell pressure is not visible yet as retail buyers flow from all directions. While retail sentiment across X remains euphoric and todays fake pump that ended with a downside move after hitting the 125k will provide one more headline in the news "BTC NEW ATH" attracting more retails to jump in. While we see the same pattern in the stock market with record retail inflows since August, financial market indicators are flashing early warnings of a liquidity crunch brewing beneath the surface.

1. The Repo Crisis That No One Wants to See
Every major market correction begins with a liquidity problem hidden in plain sight. Today, that red flag is the Reverse Repo (RRP) market. RRP usage has collapsed from a $2.2 trillion peak (mid-2022) to just $8‚Äì10 billion today, a 99% drawdown. This ‚Äúcash on the sidelines‚Äù narrative is officially dead. The buffer that once stabilized interbank liquidity has vanished. Historical parallels (2018, 2019, 2023) show that when RRP dries up completely, markets soon face severe dislocations, repo stress, funding squeezes, or even emergency Fed interventions. The Standing Repo Facility (SRF) is now the only liquidity backstop. If reserves fall near $3 trillion, banks will tap it aggressively, the modern version of ‚Äúprinting in panic.‚Äù but it will be too late. Translation: We are one shock away from testing the Fed‚Äôs tolerance for financial pain. I keep repeating my words, dont fight the Dollar (DXY) and the golden rise is ahead for the DXY!

2. The ‚Äú$7 Trillion in MMFs‚Äù Myth
A popular claim on X and elsewhere is that ‚Äú$7 trillion in Money Market Funds (MMFs)‚Äù will soon flood equities or crypto. That is 1000% false as MMF capital must flow into T-Bills, repos, or the Fed‚Äôs RRP facility, not assets. When MMF cash moves, it DRAINS liquidity from the real market, not adds to it. In short, the liquidity pyramid is tightening from the top down, not expanding.

3. U.S. Banking Fragility
U.S. banks hold roughly $395 billion in unrealized losses (Q2 2025), quietly pressuring balance sheets. History shows: The Fed doesn‚Äôt start printing in calm seas, it waits for something to happen. A controlled crash may be exactly what they need before launching QE 5.0

4. Crypto Market:
ETF inflows: BlackRock and other issuers added >$1 billion in BTC and $200 million in ETH last week and Large wallets have slowed but not fully stopped in selling since late September; short-term holders already capitulated in August‚ÄìSeptember. Bollinger Bands, the tightest since major breakouts, suggest a strong move is near to one or the other direction. Remember: Bitcoin has never decoupled from stock-market liquidity. If equities face a repo-driven shock, BTC will initially dip with risk assets before becoming the first beneficiary of the post-crash liquidity wave. Retail traders are once again chanting the ‚Äúliquidity flood‚Äù myth, ignoring macro fragility. This is the same delusion seen before the 2022 crash, euphoria at the edge of systemic stress. We can see clear FOMO metrics are rising. Leveraged longs are at cycle highs and Yet under the surface, liquidity is collapsing. Since August I have sold my entire Crypto Assets and started to build short positions in the region of 115-125k with current average entry of 119,9k region. My plan is to hold the shorts and consider the current zone as banana zone which is indeed a sideway zone between 115-125k as told in August. Next to the tripple top we also see a massive bearish divergence forming on the weekly chart, the same divergence was the reason for the end of 2021 bull market, we see the same indicator giving us a warning again! A warning that should not be ignored in my opinion! If for any reason BTC breaks out above my 125k level, I need to prepare to hold for several days/ weeks in red before it turns back in profit. My strategy is for the long term and I held my coins for 3 years before selling them all realising a massive profit of 600% in BTC alone or selling ETH at the top of $4,800. More than happy to be positioned well for the upcoming events. In the meantime, drinking tea and relax.

5. MSTR & the Yield-Panic Signal
MicroStrategy raised its preferred-share yields from 10% ‚Üí 10.25% (up from 9% only weeks ago), a sign of funding strain. Behind the scenes, Saylor‚Äôs ‚ÄúBitcoin flywheel‚Äù ($MSTR ‚Üí $STRC/$STRD/$STRF preferreds) is losing traction. Constant share dilution has eroded MSTR‚Äôs mNAV premium, now underperforming BTC by ~25% in 6 months.  New preferred issuances try to mask liquidity gaps with double-digit dividends, an unsustainable model unless BTC keeps rising faster than issuance. Without fresh inflows, the structure risks becoming a closed-loop Ponzi flywheel, similar in dynamic to Terra/Luna and the reason for the next bear market.

6. Inisider Selling: Since August we see the largest amount of Insider sales in the last 2-3 years, till this day insiders continue to dump their own shares into the market in a massive speed. At the same time we have the largest retail investor inflow as well! This mix is highly toxic and usually occurs at cycle tops!

Question for the Bulls: If you believe 140k will hit before the bear market starts that‚Äôs only 14% higher from here. Are you really willing to risk everything for a possible 14% move? What if the market never reaches 140k? You‚Äôll be stuck holding, waiting for a top that never comes, and end up selling much lower, or not selling at all. This is how every cycle ends for most people: ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt take profits.‚Äù See you in a month! Premium will remain active and updated as usual.

MACRO ECONOMY IS IN BIG DANGER!

First and more importantly, no matter when the recession crash happens, either in the next weeks or in Q1-Q2 2026 as described below, the 90-94k Bitcoin target remains regardless!

The yield curve is one of the best leading indicators of the economy. It compares the interest paid on short-term US government bonds (2-year) with long-term bonds (10-year). Normally, long bonds pay more because you are lending for longer. That‚Äôs called a positive spread. When the opposite happens and short bonds pay more, it‚Äôs called an inversion. An inversion signals that investors expect trouble ahead and that the Fed will be forced to cut rates.

The yield curve (10Y‚Äì2Y) inverted on July 5, 2022 and stayed inverted for 784 days, the longest inversion in U.S. history. Every single recession of the last 50 years has been preceded by this signal. On Aug 27, 2024 the curve flipped back positive (+0.56%). History shows the crash comes ALWAYS after normalization, not during inversion. Same happened in 1990, 2001, 2007 and now most recently in 2024-2025.  Looking back at history, the lag between normalization and the start of a recession (Market Crash) was always short. In 1990, the recession began about 180 days after the curve turned positive. In 2001, it took only 60 days. In 2007, it was around 180 days again. So historically the lag has been in the 2‚Äì6 month range, but this cycle the inversion itself lasted much longer than any other cycle in history (784 days). The Fed already began cutting rates before a recession started, similar to what happened in 2001. The labor market is only now starting to weaken, with unemployment rising to 4.3% and job growth heavily revised down. So this time the clock is running much longer, 550‚Äì650 days but history still says the outcome is the same. A recessionary crash is coming, only with a bigger delay. So as per the calendar when should it start? We are now entering the high risk area in which the recession (Market crash) is going to hit the markets hard. Now, till Q2 2026 is high risk area and the big crash is going to happen in this timeline.  On top of it Bond market SCREAMS HIGH RISK: 10Y \~4.05%, 2Y \~3.47%. Falling yields + positive spread are not bullish. This is exactly what we saw before 2001 and 2007 crashes, ‚Äúback to normal‚Äù that was actually the calm before the storm.

My Position

The last post about the Inversion/ Positive spread recession indicator is one more confirming indicator for the big downside move and many of you missed the MAIN point. The next decisive move is BTC tagging 90‚Äì94K. The plan has not changed and I‚Äôve said it for a month: sell 10% of spot daily into strength and load shorts whenever the market offers the 115‚Äì125K distribution zone. Because price slipped below our main short window, we‚Äôve already executed 70% capital sits in USDT/shorts, and the remaining 30% spot is waiting for a retest of the short zone to unload and add even more shorts.
